original_title: Sri Lanka plans CO2 sequestration to be carbon neutral by 2050
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers has approved a road map and strategic plan to achieve carbon neutral status by 2050, Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
A team of experts after consultations with stakeholders have come up with a “Carbon Net Zero – 2050 Roadmap and Strategic Plan.
The plan has identified potential measures to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and increase carbon sequestration.

Sri Lanka as party to Paris Agreement has already committed to be carbon neutral by 2050, through an updated ‘Nationally Determined Contribution submitted to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change’. (Colombo/Nov28/2023)
